page.title: 03BAR HILL
page.content: The shops,village green,community centre &etc all being,more or less,in the centre.There is plenty of play areas,open space,trees and attractive landscaping.The main service road,the perimeter road,encircles the village and all the housing areas are reached, by traffic,from this road - there are, therefore, no main roads to be crossed,in the village itself,by pedestrians. Bar Hill is placed well for other towns and cities.It is at the head of the new M11 to London,the A1 is only twelve miles away,Cambridge is about six miles to the south and Huntingdon and St.Ives are a few miles north. As Bar Hill is so new we did a questionnaire survey to see what the residents think of their village.The results of this survey are given on later pages.
